resources.string: Vedanshu Tiwari, Aditya Sonel, Ankur Soni, Hansraj Meena, Gourav Neema, Faim Sheikh, Rahul Dhote, Rajendra Ojha, Shrivatsa Malviya, Nitesh Pandey, Hitesh Pariyani and many more friends.
Born by the passion and a dream of friends, brought to life thanks to a wonderful collaboration started with an amazing guy.

Pocket RGPV is a mobile version of RGPV website. It consist almost all features that is useful for students like syllabus, schemes, time table, result, latest notification and some useful links. We are continuously working to make Pocket RGPV more better. Keep supporting us, keep giving feedback to make Pocket RGPV more better, Thanks !!!

here NCj is the number of total credits offered in the j th semester, SGj is the SGPA earned in the j th semester, where j = 1,2,...m, are the number of semesters in that programme.

Each student, registered for a programme, shall be awarded grade by the concerned faculty / faculties for the specific subject/paper. The grades awarded to a student shall depend upon his continuous evaluation through performance in various examinations, assignments, quizzes, laboratory work, internship, class work, mid semester test and regularity. The grades to be used and their numerical equivalents are as under :
Division shall be awarded only after the final semester examination based on integrated performance of the candidate for all the years as per following details :

Promotion to Higher Semester Under Credit Based Grading System:-
The criteria for continuation of study is as follows:
1) To clear a particular subject the required grade and grade point is D (4.0).

2) For promotion to next higher class, the required Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) at the end of even semester is 5.0 and Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) for completion of course/degree is also 5.0. For calculating CGPA, in a given year at the End of even semester, the marks obtained in the odd & even semester of that year shall only be considered.
3) The criteria for promotion to the next higher odd semester shall be governed by concerned ordinance of University.
{ All information based on the Ordinance no. 30 Section 40(1) issued by RGPV, Bhopal }
The degree course consists of 8 semester (4 year). The system of calculating the aggregate of total course is as follows:

1. 10% weightage of First Year
2. 20% weightage of Second Year
3. 30% weightage of Third Year 
4. 100% weightage of Fourth Year
{ All information based on the Transcript Format issued by RGPV, Bhopal }
